thread.title: $A lower as $US rises on Greece headlines
thread.title_full: $A lower as $US rises on Greece headlines

title: $A lower as $US rises on Greece headlines
text:
Mon, Jul 20, 2015, 9:08 AM NZST - New Zealand Markets open in 52 mins. $A lower as $US rises on Greece headlines AAP – 12 minutes ago Print 
The Australian dollar is lower against the greenback which has risen to a three-month high amid developments in Greece's debt saga. 
At 0630 AEST on Monday, the local currency was trading at 73.83 US cents, down from 74.08 cents on Friday. 
In Greece, a revamped government has taken over in an effort to enforce tough fiscal reforms that accompany a third bailout and are opposed by part of the ruling Syriza party. 
CURRENCY SNAPSHOT AT 0630 AEST ON MONDAY 
One Australian dollar buys: 
* 73.83 US cents, from 74.08 cents on Friday 
* 91.56 Japanese yen, from 91.88 yen 
* 68.12 euro cents, from 68.05 euro cents 
(*Currency closes taken at 1700 AEST previous local session) 
Source: IRESS Market focus on Greek crisis eases AAP
